items.sentence: We\'ll face that problem when we come to it.
Tom has been over to your place, hasn\'t he?
Tom encouraged Mary to take ukulele lessons.
Tom feels exactly the same way as Mary does.
Tom fell asleep watching the Olympics on TV.
Have you forgotten that you were young once?
I\'ll have everyone call me Tom from now on.
I\'m glad you found the money that you lost.
I\'m just not cut out for this kind of work.
I just don\'t want to make the wrong choice.
I just don\'t want to talk about it anymore.
I just stood there and didn\'t say anything.
I just want to make sure this isn\'t poison.
Let\'s hope everything gets better tomorrow.
Let\'s introduce ourselves to our neighbors.
Let\'s just sit here for a while and listen.
Let\'s look at these problems one at a time.
There is one thing that I don\'t understand.
There isn\'t much nutrition in potato chips.
Tom said that Mary looked very disappointed.
Tom said that Mary seemed somewhat confused.
Every bride is beautiful on her wedding day.
Tom wanted to get married, but Mary didn\'t.
I don\'t understand why you want to do that.
I didn\'t think Tom would have any problems.
I didn\'t think that was supposed to happen.
I didn\'t understand a single word Tom said.
I didn\'t want to do what Tom told me to do.
Mary hardly ever kisses her husband anymore.
Mary is no longer the shy girl she once was.
Mary is saving money so she can go to Japan.
Mary is still wearing the ring Tom gave her.
These kinds of problems are relatively rare.
These problems must be dealt with carefully.
They accused me of having broken my promise.
They advised me to go to the police station.
All of my students call me by my first name.
Before buying shoes, you should try them on.
Did you learn to swim when you were a child?
I think that what you did was inappropriate.
Tom and Mary exchange gifts every Christmas.
Tom and Mary first met at a party in Boston.
Let\'s try to come up with something better.
Tom will be the designated driver this time.
Tom will come back home when he gets hungry.
Tom will never find out about what happened.
Tom won a prize in the spelling competition.
Tom and Mary have been invited to Australia.
Tom has gotten fired from more than one job.
Tom has had a fever for the past three days.
